snippet.textDisplay: The reviews for this game have been all over the place and I'm not surprised. There are probably 2 camps here: those who are disappointed that it's too similar to Banjo-Kazooie after all these years, and those who are happy that it's just that. I did hear that the 2nd half doesn't feel as polished as the first, so there might be that as well. Anyhow, it's good to see good ol' Kirkhope and Wise working together on a soundtrack!
snippet.textOriginal: The reviews for this game have been all over the place and I'm not surprised. There are probably 2 camps here: those who are disappointed that it's too similar to Banjo-Kazooie after all these years, and those who are happy that it's just that. I did hear that the 2nd half doesn't feel as polished as the first, so there might be that as well. Anyhow, it's good to see good ol' Kirkhope and Wise working together on a soundtrack!

snippet.textDisplay: Yes. There may be some few soundtracks out there that you cannot upload on youtube, but if you happen to upload one of them, all you need to do is delete the video. I think youtube automatically makes them unwatchable if that is the case. Also, you will get a message of youtube what to do if this occurs.
snippet.textOriginal: Yes. There may be some few soundtracks out there that you cannot upload on youtube, but if you happen to upload one of them, all you need to do is delete the video. I think youtube automatically makes them unwatchable if that is the case. Also, you will get a message of youtube what to do if this occurs.

snippet.textDisplay: so if i wanted to upload VGMs I could as long as I didnt monetise them?
snippet.textOriginal: so if i wanted to upload VGMs I could as long as I didnt monetise them?

snippet.textDisplay: Basically he does not monetize them. In fact, he cannot even monetize vgm themes since they are all copyrighted. However, sometimes vgm themes you upload gets banned from certain countries, but you are still able to upload them.
snippet.textOriginal: Basically he does not monetize them. In fact, he cannot even monetize vgm themes since they are all copyrighted. However, sometimes vgm themes you upload gets banned from certain countries, but you are still able to upload them.

snippet.textDisplay: Count me in the 2nd half. I'm just glad we're getting a Banjo-esque game in 2017. I don't expect it to reinvent the wheel, I just want a fun platformer in the vein of the games I used to love as a kid.
snippet.textOriginal: Count me in the 2nd half. I'm just glad we're getting a Banjo-esque game in 2017. I don't expect it to reinvent the wheel, I just want a fun platformer in the vein of the games I used to love as a kid.

snippet.textDisplay: Polished isn't the word that comes to my mind when I think of any Rare game, except maybe the DKC trilogy and Perfect Dark.  This is why they were good: They were more concerned with creativity than QA.
snippet.textOriginal: Polished isn't the word that comes to my mind when I think of any Rare game, except maybe the DKC trilogy and Perfect Dark.  This is why they were good: They were more concerned with creativity than QA.

snippet.textDisplay: I heard that it is not as polished as the Banjo-Kazooie titles in many aspects. Though I have not played the game so I would not know from personal experience. I am sure that old fans of the N64 Banjo-Kazooie will enjoy it.
snippet.textOriginal: I heard that it is not as polished as the Banjo-Kazooie titles in many aspects. Though I have not played the game so I would not know from personal experience. I am sure that old fans of the N64 Banjo-Kazooie will enjoy it.

snippet.textDisplay: I love David Wise... about Kirkhope... I unfortunately can't say the same.
snippet.textOriginal: I love David Wise... about Kirkhope... I unfortunately can't say the same.

snippet.textDisplay: I haven't seen a single critique for this game yet that couldn't be leveled at most of Rare's old games.  I've also never seen critics as a whole be so hard on a large scale game being made by a very small team (with the exception of No Man's Sky, but Sony's marketing definitely invited that).
snippet.textOriginal: I haven't seen a single critique for this game yet that couldn't be leveled at most of Rare's old games.  I've also never seen critics as a whole be so hard on a large scale game being made by a very small team (with the exception of No Man's Sky, but Sony's marketing definitely invited that).

snippet.textDisplay: My understanding, and I haven't played the game, is that Banjo was a much more inventive, well-made game with a lot more interesting things to do and a better structure. I think the critics criticizing it for not changing enough from the original are also forgetting that the original had more thought put into it from a design standpoint.
snippet.textOriginal: My understanding, and I haven't played the game, is that Banjo was a much more inventive, well-made game with a lot more interesting things to do and a better structure. I think the critics criticizing it for not changing enough from the original are also forgetting that the original had more thought put into it from a design standpoint.

snippet.textDisplay: Ohhhh right! This was that other Yooka-Laylee track unveiled during development, along with the well-known theme composed by Grant. And yeah, this is definitely David Wise, particularly David Wise coming out of Tropical Freeze. I'd be curious to see when this song plays in the game, as it's definitely pretty unique sounding when it's contrasted with Grant's style of composing music in the game :)

snippet.textDisplay:
I never knew David Wise was involved as well. I thought it was only Grant Kirkhope since it was only his music I heard in reviews and promotional trailers.

I'm going to wait to hear a port report on the Switch version before making a decision to buy this game. I heard a lot of mixed opinions on this game, and it's not solely due to the similarity of the original Banjo-Kazooie games, almost far from it.
snippet.textOriginal:
